summary: This is a legal motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team requesting severance and separate trial for Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment. The document is a formal notice of motion submitted to the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who is moving for severance of Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who signed and submitted the motion on behalf of the defense team.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C. listed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP listed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.context: Attorney from Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim listed as part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Motion for Severance Filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files a motion requesting severance and separate trial for Counts Five and Six of the superseding indictment.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
33 West 19th Street - 4th Floor, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a motion to sever Counts Five and Six from the superseding indictment for separate trial.
The motion was filed on January 25, 2021, in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.
Maxwell was represented by a substantial legal team including attorneys from multiple law firms across different states.
The document indicates ongoing pretrial motions in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (Case No. 20 Cr. 330).
The defense strategy involved challenging the structure of the indictment by seeking to separate specific counts for trial.
